div.h4: Welcome to Housatonic Valley Regional High School

div.p: Housatonic Valley Regional High School is the secondary school for students in the Region 1 School District in Connecticut. Region 1 includes the towns of Kent, Sharon, Salisbury, North Canaan, Falls Village, and Cornwall.

p.span: Your four years at Housatonic Valley Regional High School will be filled with opportunities. Our goal is to help you grow to your potential, whatever that may be.
Housatonic’s athletic program boasts one of the highest participation rates in the state of Connecticut.
The historic school building houses approximately 500 students, and is nestled in the heart of the picturesque Housatonic River Valley.
HVRHS takes pride in the leadership and educational talents of each of our departments.

h2.a: Message from Superintendent Dr. Vogel to Students & Parents (3/25/20)

div.p: Dear Parents and Students, All of the administrators are discussing things often, through email and virtual meetings, to see how things are going for our students. It’s still our hope that we can keep all students engaged in learning during the time when they are at home. Also, as was mentioned in previous communication to families, […]

h2.a: Message to students from Mr. Strever – Distance Learning (revised 3/25/20)

div.p: As of today, we are now closed through April 20, which is the Monday after our planned Spring Vacation. We are also hearing from many of you with suggestions about improvements to the distance learning experience. Therefore, starting on Friday, we will implement some changes to our week: Friday will be an open work day […]

h2.a: Meal Info from Principal, Ian Strever

div.p: Dear Students, I hope all of you are doing well and staying safe. As of Tuesday (3/17/2020), you should have started distance learning in all of your classes, and your teachers have been providing assignments that will allow you to continue your progress during this closure. h2.a: Corona Virus – Message from Superintendent Dr. Pam Vogel (3/12/2020)

div.p: Dear Parents, Students, Staff and Community Members, As you are aware, the COVID-19 situation is ever-changing. Today, a message came out from the Governor’s Office and the Department of Education Commissioner’s Office with additional information regarding the increasing numbers of Coronavirus cases in Connecticut. Superintendents throughout the state then had an opportunity to ask more questions to […]

div.p: The HVRHS community promotes personal and academic growth, as well as independence of thought and spirit for all its members, within a culture of respect, responsibility and safety.
